definition: to carry (esp. slung over the arm, shoulder or side)
to cover/to wrap/to hold/to include/to take charge of/to contract (to or for)/package/wrapper/container/bag/to hold or embrace/bundle/packet/CL:個|个[ge4],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: My shoulder bag is carry-on luggage.
I take several plastic bins, in which I place my handbag and tote bag.
sentences.chinese: 我拿起几个塑料盒子，将手提包和挎包放入盒内。

sentences.english: I can’t find the key in my bag. I must have left it in my office.
sentences.chinese: 在我的挎包里找不到钥匙，一定是忘在办公室里了。

sentences.english: The key cannot be found in my bag, it must have been left in the office.
sentences.chinese: 在我的挎包里找不到钥匙，一定是记在办公室里了。

sentences.english: Consider getting a jacket with multiple pockets, or a messenger bag to carry everything.
sentences.chinese: 买个口袋多点的夹克衫，或者买个单肩斜挎包吧。

sentences.english: A man single-handedly waved machetes in one hand and a woman, Ye Guo's satchel.
sentences.chinese: 一名男子一手挥着砍刀，一手拽过女子的挎包。

sentences.english: Many people made their pilgrimage in groups, wearing black or brown robes and shoulder bags.
sentences.chinese: 许多人集体上山朝拜，穿着黑袍或棕袍，挎着挎包。

sentences.english: This gorgeous satchel bag arrives in silver patent leather with stunning details of silver hardware studs.
sentences.chinese: 这美丽的挎包袋抵达与银硬件螺栓惊人的细节银漆皮。

sentences.english: Messenger bag with durable cotton canvas construction and weather-resistant coating.
sentences.chinese: 耐用的棉帆布建设和耐候涂料，斜挎包。

sentences.english: I'm so glad you found the bag and took the time and trouble to return it.
sentences.chinese: 我真高兴你捡到了这挎包，还不怕费时费事来还给我。

definition: bag or purse etc/small bump or pimple/hillock
